intro: Arquita trichocarpa var. boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian arquita, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces clusters of white, fragrant flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes in temperate climates.
